_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a)  ACCIDENTAL RESEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Cytec is a leader among chemical manufacturers in its safety, health and environmental programs.  Our commitment to protect our employees and the communities that are home to our operations is an integral part of Cytec's way of doing business.  Cytec has established safety, health, emergency response and environmental policies and standards designed to meet or exceed all regulatory requirements.  Cytec subscribes to the codes established for Responsible Care (R) and the Wallingford Plant is certified to RC14001, OHSAS 18001 and ISO 14001.

(b)  THE WALLINGFORD PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Our facility manufactures resin products that are used in coatings, adhesives and other similar applications.  The RMP regulated substance used above threshold quanity is formaldehyde.

(c)  THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RESEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Cytec's general accidental release prevention program includes:

- EPA 40 CFR 68 - Risk Management Plans
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 - Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 - Hazardous Waste Operations & Emergency Response
- Other EPA, OSHA, DOT and State regulations
- Generally recognized & accepted engineering codes and standards, including ACC Responsible Care Guidelines and
- Cytec Safety, Health and Environmental standards.

The following engineering and administrative controls help prevent a release of formaldehyde:
- Operating procedures and attendance during transfer operations by trained personnel
- Locked transfer connections with verification of materials prior to unloading
- High level, temperature and pressure controls with alarms and/or automatic shutoffs
- Fire prevention programs include Nitrogen inerting of certain process vessels, grounding systems, electrical wiring and equipment rated for hazardous locations where necessary 
- Distributed computer control systems with u

ninterruptible power backup and independent safety and environmental alarms and/or interlocks on various equipment
- Various level indicators and spill containment for storage tanks and production vessels
- An on-site waste water treatment plant
- 24 hour security guards and plant fire department presence
- Back up systems for some process pneumatics, lighting, electrical power to certain equipment, process water and back-up power for plant communications 
- Fire extinguishing systems include water sprinklers, AFFF foam, high expansion foam, halon systems, fire walls, water curtains, fire doors and fire valves on certain vessels
- Administrative controls include management of change procedures, mechanical integrity procedures, operating procedures, training programs for employees and contractors, contractor review procedures, pre-startup safety review procedures, process hazards analysis procedures, safety work permit procedures, hot work permit procedures and lockout procedures

(d)  5-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no incidents at the Wallingford Plant which meet the criteria for reporting in the previous five-years.
                                  
(e) EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Wallingford Plant has an extensive emergency response program.  This program includes actions to be taken by operating department, maintenance, utilities, office, technical, visitors, contractors, and plant emergency response employees.  This information can be found in the Cytec, Wallingford Plant, Emergency Response Plan.  The onsite Cytec Fire Department has an extensive amount of equipment including a foam fire truck. Drills with the Wallingford Fire Department are conducted several times a year and hands-on-training (i.e. structural fire fighting) is periodically provided at the Town Fire Service Training area.  In addition, Cyted Emergency Response teams help provide training in hazardous materials to Municipal Fire Department personnel.

(f)  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPRO

VE SAFETY

CYTEC Industries is continuously striving to upgrade its processes, control technology, employee training, inspection, repair and maintenance of process equipment in order to improve safety.  Most recently, the plant obtained a second fire truck and is outfitting it for plant use.  The plant will show continuous improvement in our environmental, safety, health, and security systems as required by ISO 14001 and RC 14001.  Reduction of emissions and improved doocument contol are two areas of improvement.
